crypto.name: Ambystoma Mexicanum
crypto.desc:
author: Entity069

The axolotl (Ambystoma mexicanum) is a species of paedomorphic mole salamander, meaning they mature without undergoing metamorphosis into the terrestrial adult form; the adults remain fully aquatic with obvious external gills.

crypto.name: Ambystoma Mexicanum Revenge
crypto.desc:
author: Entity069

The axolotls are not what they seem, they are back now, with a revenge.

crypto.name: The Job
crypto.desc:
author: L3G10N

Your non cryptography "friend" needs your help or he might lose his job. Well you don't really care you just want the flag don't you.

Anyways connect to the instance to get the flag... after helping your friend save his job ofcourse.

crypto.name: bolt fast
crypto.desc:
crypto beginner
author: lime_for_snake

Everyone keeps telling me to worry about Wiener's attack, but they just don't understand optimization. Don't bother checking my key size; it's huge. You'll never catch me! Hahahaha!

crypto.name: bread vs keys v1
crypto.desc:
author: kh4rg0sh

why did the prisoner choose bread over keys?

crypto.name: lcg 2
crypto.desc:
author: lime_for_snake

The rats that should have been easy to catch have gone rogue. Now we need to shoot em down thrice to catch the mice.

crypto.name: m4candch3353
crypto.desc:
author: jrke

Prove that you have enough power to climb the tower snatch the partially broken treasure and fix it!

crypto.name: p34kC0nj3c7ur3
crypto.desc:
crypto beginner
author: jrke

Pave your path to ultimate hash function!

forensic.name: Complete Chaos
forensic.desc:
Author: vx

We just found out two network captures from the same night. First one is whispering something in the air while the other is transmitting data over "silent" sounds. Unravel the mystery and end this chaos.

forensic.name: Fractonacci
forensic.desc:
Author: vx

Beautiful. Red. Fractonacci. What could this mean??

forensic.name: Kiidddoooo
forensic.desc:
Author: g4rud4

My younger friend is kind of old-school… and always manages to get into trouble. Note: The flag is in 4 parts.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1oLvW1r1iUKwkU7Zimq-fXZuslVQqzain

forensic.name: Sonic
forensic.desc:
Author: W01f

We intercepted a strange audio transmission. Our audio analysts say it's not music, not speech, and definitely not random noise. Can you figure out what it is?

forensic.name: Terrific Transformer
forensic.desc:
Author: W01f

Being a Prime requires making some tough decisions to prove their worth. Can you prove your worth by deciphering the hidden message in this challenge?

forensic.name: exp golomb
forensic.desc:
Author: vx

I just received these files and don't know what is going on, I hope you can piece these things up and tell me what is being hidden. Wrap the message in flag{}.

misc.name: 404 Friend Not Found
misc.desc:
Author: lime_for_snake

My friend is really adventurous and a total sucker for a thrill and sci-fi movie-type action. He used to tell me how he would come to this spot in the image and just enjoy the unique view, and his mother would worry all evening. Now, he's gone MIA again. He loves to be alone and gatekeep these secret locations he has fun at.

Now I can't contact him at all and his mother is really worried. Find out for me where he has gone... I am sure he is posting about this trip on some secret social account."

Flag Format: The flag is composed of three parts joined by underscores:

Coordinates: The location coordinates of the first image up to 3 decimal places.(35.567, 108.321)

Username: The username of the secret account. (eg. fanboy_g4m1n6_30)

Place: The name of the location where he went aloof. (Mount Abu)

Example Flag: flag{35.567_108.321_fanboy_g4m1n6_30_mount_abu}

misc.name: Mizuhashi Simple Domain
misc.desc:
Author: vx

Lab no - 0x37, tired but here is another one, what was the mode again?, resistance, impedance, admittance, oh wait....

misc.name: Title Decider
misc.desc:
Author: 3x0tic

It's the final lap. The title decider is today, and I've locked my personal favorites behind a flag and my name that only the real ones will understand. I've left my preferences scattered across history, pop culture, and the grid. Can you trace my tire tracks to find the 5 things that define me?

(Don't forget to join our Discord btw.)

Format: flag{food_place_date_car_song} (Note: All answers are one word. The date is in DDMMYY format.)

pwn.name: Gamble
pwn.desc:
Author: d3let3-57

My friends and I planned a trip to Gokarna and heard about a famous casino with a machine that almost never lets anyone win, only the truly lucky. I’ve replicated it. Let’s see if you are one of them!

pwn.name: Lolimancer
pwn.desc:
Author: Epsilon

The lolimancer does not concern himself with the opinion of puts.

Note: command to patch files Patchelf --set-interpreter ./libc.so ./chall

pwn.name: Makeine
pwn.desc:
Authors: Epsilon & Jrke

Whom Do you Help,Aging or pochita?

pwn.name: Santas Workshop
pwn.desc:
Author: whoami

Explore Santa's magical gift workshop and uncover the mysteries of the North Pole. Ho Ho Ho!

pwn.name: The Last Duel
pwn.desc:
Author: l3v1

Can you survive the duel, and bring back flag to your homeland?

pwn.name: skernel
pwn.desc:
Author: sh4dy
Just another kernel exploitation challenge :)

pwn.name: vibe kode
pwn.desc:
Author: p0ch1ta

You can vibe code kernel modules right? Right........?

rev.name: Backdoor
rev.desc:
author: segfault

Note: This is a Reversing + Crypto + Forensics challenge.

Last night when I was monitoring the network connections of my computer I found that it was communicating with a remote server and I think it is backdoored. The packets exchanged are also encrypted. An interesting thing I observed was that these connections only happen when I use sudo. Can you help me find out the backdoor and what data was compromised?

rev.name: Easy Crackme
rev.desc:
author: Pr15h

Let's have an easy one to end the things. enclose the printable output flag{}

rev.name: Infinity
rev.desc:
author: it4ch1

This challenge goes on… and on… and on. Just when you think you've reached the end, it keeps going. Stages after stages—until finally, at the very end... well.... it still goes on. And remember it must go on..

rev.name: Not so easy
rev.desc:
author: continental

I am done with this bruh

rev.name: SIMD Highway
rev.desc:
author: 21verses

All paths lead to rome

rev.name: The Stage
rev.desc:
author: v1bh475u

Strange how something broken still manages to communicate at all...

rev.name: To jmp or not jmp
rev.desc:
author: v1bh475u

Another flag checker, eh? But the code is beyond my understanding. It makes my head spin! There's just too many jumps!

rev.name: Vault
rev.desc:
author: continental

I heard you are a master at breaking vaults, try to break this one..

rev.name: Where code
rev.desc:
author: v1bh475u

That's it! I am done! I tried but cannot find any useful code! I am handing down this to you! Find the code and get the flag! Good luck!

rev.name: mazerunner
rev.desc:
author: sh4rk

is this even solvable?

web.name: Flask of Cookies
web.desc:
Author: c0ok1e

A tiny Flask app that looks harmless… or does it? Some things aren’t quite what they seem, especially the parts you can’t see. Take a closer look — maybe there’s a way to convince the system you’re someone else.

web.name: Go Touch Grass
web.desc:
author: 3x0t1c

You need to work hard to touch some grass

web.name: Image Gallery
web.desc:
author:c00k1e

The gallery seems calm… but a secret lies behind the scenes.

web.name: MCP Mayhem
web.desc:
Authors: dr4g0n & v1p3r

Welcome to our brand new MCP (Model Context Protocol) aggregator service! Connect to multiple servers, call tools, and do math operations - all through one sleek proxy.

Surely there's nothing that could go wrong with this modern architecture... right?

Note: Add this to your /etc/hosts in order to connect to the challenge

web.name: MarketFlow
web.desc:
author: j4ck4l

Marketing campaings make companies bigger.

web.name: Shop of life
web.desc:
Welcome to our shop of life :) You will get a redeem for every individual user, but you can avail it only once.

Notes: The service is reachable over HTTPS (HTTP/3 via QUIC). Keep your user_id safe; it’s your wallet.

web.name: Trust Issues
web.desc:
Author: c0ok1e

A simple admin panel… with questionable trust decisions. Break them and extract what the server is hiding. Flag format: flag\{[a-z0-9_]+\}.
